systems.name: Alpha Centauri
systems.description: Alpha Centauri is the closest star system and closest planetary system to Earth's Solar System at 4.37 light-years from the Sun.

planets.name: Proxima Centauri b
planets.description: Proxima Centauri b is an exoplanet orbiting in the habitable zone of the red dwarf star Proxima Centauri.

planets.name: Proxima Centauri c
planets.description: Proxima Centauri c is a confirmed exoplanet, orbiting the red dwarf star Proxima Centauri.

systems.name: TRAPPIST-1
systems.description: TRAPPIST-1 is an ultra-cool red dwarf star that is slightly larger but much more massive than the planet Jupiter, located 39.6 light-years from the Sun.

planets.name: TRAPPIST-1 b
planets.description: TRAPPIST-1 b is the innermost planet and is likely to have a rocky composition.

planets.name: TRAPPIST-1 c
planets.description: TRAPPIST-1 c is the second innermost planet and is composed primarily of rock and iron.

systems.name: The solar system
systems.description: The solar system is a massive planetary system, with nine planets orbiting our star - the Sun. It also includes dwarf planets, asteroids, comets, and much more.

planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: The smallest planet in the solar system and the closest to the Sun.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: A terrestrial planet and is sometimes referred to as the Earth's sister planet due to their similar size, mass, proximity to the Sun and bulk composition.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: The only planet known to support life and is the third planet from the Sun.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: A terrestrial planet and is often called the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: The largest planet in the Solar System and it is primarily composed of hydrogen with a quarter of its mass being helium.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: The second-largest planet in the Solar System and is known for its extensive ring system.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: The seventh planet from the Sun and is an ice giant.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: The eighth planet from the Sun and is the most distant known planet in the Solar System.
